### Neovim version (nvim -v)

v0.8.0-dev+404-g2b539d6fd

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

n/a

### Operating system/version

Ubuntu 20.04.4

### Terminal name/version

alacritty 0.10.0-dev

### $TERM environment variable

tmux-256color

### Installation

build from repo

### How to reproduce the issue

```lua
local api = vim.api

local parent_bufnr = api.nvim_create_buf(false, true)
local parent_winid = api.nvim_open_win(parent_bufnr, false, {
  relative = "win",
  row = 5,
  col = 10,
  height = 20,
  width = 40,
  border = "double",
  zindex = 50,
})

local child_bufnr = api.nvim_create_buf(false, true)
local child_winid = api.nvim_open_win(child_bufnr, false, {
  relative = "win",
  win = parent_winid,
  row = 1,
  col = 1,
  height = 5,
  width = 10,
  border = "rounded",
  zindex = 55,
})

vim.defer_fn(function()
  api.nvim_win_close(child_winid, true)
  api.nvim_win_close(parent_winid, true)
end, 10000)
```

### Expected behavior

Running the script would

- open the parent window positioned relative to the current window
- open the child window positioned relative to parent window

### Actual behavior

Running the script

- open the parent window positioned relative to the current window
- opens the child window positioned relative to the current window (instead of being relative to parent window)

---

### Additional Observations

#### Enter parent window after opening it

After both windows are open, if the parent window is focused by pressing `Ctrl-W` twice, the child window's position is corrected.

#### Make parent window non-focusable

If `focusable` is set to `false` for parent window:

```lua
local parent_winid = api.nvim_open_win(parent_bufnr, false, {
  focusable = false,
```

The previous case "Enter parent window after opening it" is not possible anymore.

#### Enter parent window while opening it

If the second argument to `nvim_open_win` is set to `true`:

```lua
local parent_winid = api.nvim_open_win(parent_bufnr, true, {
```

Then the parent window is focused right after opening it and the child window is positioned relative to the parent window correctly.

---

Related Issue:
- https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/14735
title: float window position relative to another float window is not positioned correctly
